snippet: The government of President Lee Myung-bak took the step in an effort to extricate itself from the political debacle it created by attempting to enhance military cooperation with Japan.
abstract: Kim Tae-hyo, a top national security aide in South Korea, resigns under pressure as the government of Pres Lee Myung-bak struggles to extricate itself from the political debacle it created by trying to enhance military cooperation with Japan; Kim is the most prominent casualty so far of the fiasco Lee’s government unleashed when it quietly approved a pact on sharing confidential military data on North Korea with Japan; government underestimated the public's misgivings about cooperating militarily with Japan.
lead_paragraph: The government of President Lee Myung-bak took the step in an effort to extricate itself from the political debacle it created by attempting to enhance military cooperation with Japan.

headline.seo: Top South Korean Aide Steps Down Over Pact With Japan
headline.main: South Korea Fires Top Presidential Aide Over Pact With Japan
headline.print_headline: Korean Aide Steps Down In Reaction To Japan Pact
